text:
We dont have a pom for ant-testutil, or a stage in the test-jar target to copy
it over with the JAR. This will stop downstream maven/ivy users from pulling it in.
creator: stevel@apache.org
antoine@apache.org
text:
Hello Steve,

ant-testutil.jar is also not part of the binary distribution of ant.
we should discuss on dev at ant whether it should be part of the distro.

If it is part of the distro, then it should have a pom. Otherwise no.

Regards,

Antoine

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
1. test-jar creates it

2. downstream projects do use it, and until they move to antunit, its the best
way to test stuff. There are also some things that ant-testutil can do that
antunit can't, primarily because you can make assertions in Java, not Ant. I am
one of the  downstream users

Seems to me that if we have a task test-jar to create the jar, we should also
recreate a valid pom at the same time.

creator: antoine@apache.org
text:
in this case we need to change build.xml also to include ant-testutil.jar in the
offical distribution. This is not the case until now.
Pom file has ben created, and build file modified to build ant-testutil.
creator: antoine@apache.org
